error.detail: Three or more numeric arguments are given
(e.g., 1,2,3D or H,cT).
At sign not allowed for command, or more than
one at sign specififed.
An O command was specified with an invalid tag.
Tags may only contain graphic ASCII characters
(excluding commas which are reserved for computed
GOTOs). Leading and trailing spaces are ignored,
but embedded spaces are not allowed.

error.message: Right angle bracket not in iteration
error.detail: A right angle bracket was not matched by a left
angle bracket (Note: a loop in a Q-register
macro must be complete within the macro.)
A command was input that has not been configured.
Modify makefile to include this command, and then
rebuild TECO.
The numeric argument to an EE command was
not an ASCII character.

error.message: An EG or EZ command is too long
error.detail: An EG or EZ command was longer than 4095 characters.
A colon preceded a command that does not allow
colons, or there were too many colons specified
for the command.
A ] command has been executed and there is
nothing saved on the Q-register push down list.
An expression tried to divide a number by zero.
Display mode support is either missing or disabled.
A D command attempted to delete text outside
the current page.
An O command found a duplicate tag within the
command string.
A system call failed. The error message text
explains the error.
A command attempted to use an extended feature
which is not currently enabled.
An attempt was made to open a directory, FIFO,
socket, or similar file specification instead
of a regular file.
The requested input file could not be located.
If this occurred within a macro, the
colon-modified command may be necessary.
The argument preceding a :A command is
negative or zero.
A search argument contains a ^E command that
is either not defined or incomplete.
An invalid E command has been executed.
An invalid F command has been executed.
The numeric expression preceding a command
doesn't make sense. For example, 5+
isn't a complete expression.
A file name contained one or more invalid
characters. Check your operating system
documentation to determine what characters
are valid for file names.
A command of the form "nItext`" was attempted.
This combination of character and text
insertion is not allowed.
An attempt has been made to execute an invalid
TECO command.
An 8 or 9 was used in a digit string for an
octal number, or a 0x or 0X prefix was not
followed by a hexadecimal number.
An m argument was provided to a command which
does not allow it.
An n argument was provided to a command which
does not allow it.
The argument preceding a P or PW command is
negative or zero.
One of the valid " qualifiers did not
follow the quote character.
An invalid Q-register name was specified in one
of the Q-register commands.
The argument to a ^R radix command must be 8, 10
or 16.
The argument preceding a search command is 0.
This argument must not be 0.
One of the search string special characters
(^Q, ^V, ^W, etc.) would have modified the
search string delimiter (usually <ESC>).
The character following a ^ must have an ASCII
value between 64 and 95 inclusive, or between
141 and 172 inclusive.
An invalid key was specified for an FM command.
An O command cannot jump to a location inside a
loop, other than the one the O command may be in,
or inside a conditional.
Every conditional (started with the "
command) must be closed with the ' command.
Loops and conditionals are limited to a maximum
of 32 levels, macros are limited to a depth of 64
levels, and file names are limited to 4095 characters.
Insufficient memory available to complete the
current command.
There is a right parenthesis trhat is not matched
by a corresponding left parenthesis.
A command or match control construct did not
include a required Q-register name.
There is a left angle bracket that has no matching
right angle bracket. A loop must be complete
within a macro or command string.
There is a left parenthesis that is not matched by
a corresponding right parenthesis.
A ' command (end of conditional) was
encountered. Every ' command must be
matched by a preceding " (start of a
conditional) command.
The ^_ command must be preceded by either a
specific numeric argument or a command that
returns a numeric value.
A command has been executed in which a , is
not preceded by a numeric argument.
The =, ==, or === command must be preceded by
either a specific numeric argument or a command
that returns a numeric value.
A right parenthesis has been encountered and
is not properly preceded by a specific numeric
argument or a command that returns a numeric value.
The " commands must be preceded by a single
numeric argument on which the decision to
execute the following commands or skip to
the matching ' is based.
The ; command must be preceded by a single
numeric argument on which the decision to
execute the following commands or skip to
the matching > is based.

error.message: Cannot have n argument and text string
error.detail: Both an n argument and a string were specified for
a command which does not allow more than one.
The U comand must be preceded by either a specific
numeric argument or a command that returns a
numeric value.
A comma was preceded by a negative number.
Before issuing an input command, such as Y, it
is necessary to open an input file by use of a
command such as ER or EB.
Before issuing an output command, such as N or
or P, it is necessary to open an output file with
a command such as EW or EB.

error.message: No n argument after m argument
error.detail: An m argument was not followed by an n argument.
No tag was found for an O command.
A P command was preceded by a negative or 0 argument.
The Y command must not be preceded by either a
numeric argument or a command that returns a
numeric value.
A command was issued that is not yet implemented
in this version of TECO.
A command has been executed which tried to
create an output file, but an output file
currently is open. It is typically appropriate
to use the EC or EK command as the situation
calls for to close the output file.
The command string has become too complex.
Simplify it.

error.message: Attempt to move pointer off page with '%c'
error.detail: A J, C or R command has been executed which
attempted to move the pointer off the page.
The result of executing one of these commands
must leave the pointer between 0 and Z,
The characters referenced by a D or nA
command must also be within the buffer limits.
A ; command has been executed outside of a
loop.
A search command not preceded by a colon
modifier and not within an iteration has
failed to find the specified " command.
After an S search fails the pointer is
left at the beginning of the buffer.
After an N or _ search fails the last
page of the input file has been input
and, in the case of N, output, and the
buffer is cleared. In the case of an N
search it is usually necessary to close
the output file and reopen it.
The tag specified by an O command cannot
be found. This tag must be in the same macro
level as the O command referencing it.
Text delimiters must be graphic ASCII characters
in the range of [33,126], or control characters
in the range of [1,26]. Characters such as spaces
or ESCapes may not be used for delimiters.
This is a general error which is usually
caused by an unterminated insert, search,
or filename argument, an unterminated ^A
message, an unterminated tag or comment
(i.e., unterminated ! construct), or a
missing ' character which closes a
conditional execution command.
This error is that same as the ?UTC error
except that the unterminated command was
executing from a Q-register (i.e., it was
a macro). (Note: An entire command sequence
stored in a Q-register must be complete within
the Q-register.)
Execution of TECO was aborted. This is usually
due to the typing of <CTRL/C>.
An attempt has been made to execute a Y
or _ search command with an output file
open, that would cause text in the edit
buffer to be erased without outputting it
to the output file. The ED command controls
this check.
